message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We use data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and the UNCTAD's BACI database to investigate the relationship between foreign direct investment and enterprise productivity growth in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "UNCTAD's BACI database"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "By combining the dataset on household expenditure and income with national accounts data, we examine the extent and nature of poverty and inequality in Indonesia.", "dataset": ["dataset on household expenditure", "national accounts data"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses National Statistics Institute's (INE) official statistics on population and employment for 2002-2020 as well as migration data from the Ministry of Labor and Social Security to analyze the effects of labor mobility across regions and provinces in Spain.", "dataset": ["National Statistics Institute's (INE) official statistics on population and employment for 2002-2020", "migration data from the Ministry of Labor and Social Security"], "topic": ["Migration"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from three sources - the Demographic and Health Surveys, the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys, and the UN Population Division - we present a comprehensive picture of the progress made toward improving maternal and child health across low- and middle-income countries in sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia since 1990.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys", "UN Population Division"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "The paper employs two datasets: survey data collected from manufacturers operating in Ghana's manufacturing sector and an input-output dataset constructed using Ghana's IO tables.", "dataset": ["survey data collected from manufacturers operating in Ghana's manufacturing sector", "input-output dataset constructed using Ghana's IO tables"], "topic": ["Manufacturing"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses administrative data from the public employment service, social security records, and an online job vacancy board to understand the usage of public employment services and job search behavior in Spain during the Great Recession.", "dataset": ["administrative data from the public employment service", "social security records", "online job vacancy board"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize national household survey data from 2013 to 2019 and a nationwide dataset on electricity grid expansion to investigate the causal relationship between household electrification and children's educational achievement in rural Indonesia.", "dataset": ["national household survey data from 2013 to 2019", "nationwide dataset on electricity grid expansion"], "topic": ["Education", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using panel data from 521 districts in India over the period from 2005 to 2014, this paper analyzes the determinants of women's participation in the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS) and the effect of MGNREGS participation on women's social empowerment and household welfare.", "dataset": ["panel data from 521 districts in India over the period from 2005 to 2014"], "topic": ["Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the Lusaka Water Security Initiative, Remote Sensing images from the Landsat satellite, and hydrological modeling to map and measure how land use change affects water quantity and quality downstream of Lusaka in Zambia.", "dataset": ["Lusaka Water Security Initiative", "Remote Sensing images from the Landsat satellite", "hydrological modeling"], "topic": ["Water", "Land Use Change"]}, {"sentence": "We synthesize evidence from multiple datasets- the Integrated Public Use Microdata Series, American Community Survey, Current Population Survey, and National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent to Adult Health- to explore the intersections between educational attainment, income inequality, and health in the United States.", "dataset": ["Integrated Public Use Microdata Series", "American Community Survey", "Current Population Survey", "National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent to Adult Health"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Health"]}]
